msContents.summary: I) Gadla Yoḥannǝs Maṭmǝq “Vita of John the Baptist” (fols. 4ra-78ra) II) Taʾammǝra Yoḥannǝs Maṭmǝq “Miracles of John the Baptist”: 13 miracles (fols. 78ra-88vb) III) Malkǝʾa Yoḥannǝs Maṭmǝq “Image of John the Baptist”: 28 strophes (fols. 89rb-90va) Colophon.

msItem.note: - About the literature on John the Baptist, cp. EAE III, 288-91.
- Text I is a compilation of several homilies on John the Baptist.
- In Text II, all the miracles are numbered; the numerals for Miracles 1, 2, 3, 5 are written in the left margin of the column.
- The word እስራኤል፡ (ʾƎsrāʾel) is usually written ፳ኤል፡ (20-ʾel) (e.g., 46va l.6, 65va l.3).
- Compressed script used for Text III (esp. 89vb-90va).

msContents.colophon: 89ra: ተፈጸመ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ አመ፡ ፪ለጳጉሜን፡ በ፲ወ፱፻፷ወ፪ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ በ፴ወ፱ዘመነ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ለንጉሥነ፡ ኃይለ፡ ሥላሴ፡ በእደ፡ ጸሐፊሁ፡ አለቃ፡ ድራር፡ ወልደ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ዘብሔረ፡ ልጋት፡ ወዘአጽሐፈቶ፡ ወይዘሮ፡ ምሕረታ፡ ወልደ፡ ኪዳን፡ በ፻ወ፳ብሩር፡ ወወሀበቶ፡ ለታቦተ፡ ዮሐንሰ፡ ደብረ፡ ማዕጾ፨ ዘሠረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ ርጉመ፡ ይኩን፡ ከመ፡ አርዮስ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ለይኩን፡ ለይኩን፡ ለይኩን፨89ra: This book was completed on the 2nd Ṗagumen, in the year of mercy 1962, in 39th year of the reign of our King Ḫāyla Śǝllāse, by the hands of his scribe ʾalaqā Dǝrar Walda Qirqos, of the region of Lǝgat. And the one who let him write (was) wayzaro Mǝḥrata Walda Kidān, for 120 Bǝrur, and she gave it to the tabot of Yoḥannǝs of Dabra Maʿṣo. Anyone who stole it, or who erased it, be cursed like Arius by authority of Peter and Paul. So be it, so be it, so be it. 2nd Ṗagumen, 1962 of the year of mercy (= 6 September 1969 A.D.) is indicated as the date of the completion of the manuscript. Lǝgat is the place and church (of Qirqos) located close to Zälambäsa.

Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist; names of the owners; name of the King Ḫāyla Śǝllāse in the colophon. A group of lines, alternating with black lines, in the incipit page of Texts I, II, and in the incipit of Text III; incipit (2 lines) of each sub section (homilies) in Text I and of each miracle in Text II; the word salām in Text III; initial line of the colophon. Elements of Ethiopian numerals, of punctuations signs and of text dividers; marginal notes or their decorative elements; elements of quire marks.

decoDesc.decoNote: 4r (incipit of Text I): simple, coloured (orange, red, rose, rose, black), ornamental band with two lateral and one central extensions reaching the bottom of the text (interlaces).

item.desc: Monthly readings of Text I are indicated by the name of the month, written in the upper margin in red or black ink (decorated by two lines, one below and one above, or by red and black dots all around): ዘሐምሌ: fol. 12r ዘነሐሴ: fol. 20r መስከረም: fol. 27r ዘጥቅምት: fol. 34v ዘኅዳር: fol. 41r የካቲት: fol. 48r ዘታህሣስ[sic]: fol. 54v ዘጥር: 59v ዘመጋቢት፡: fol. 61r ዘሚያዝያ፡: fol. 65r ዘግንቦት: fol. 70r ዘዘወትር፨ fol. 74v.

- Corrections (words or letters) written interlineally: e.g., fols. 16ra, 18ra, 26vb, 38ra, 42va, 64vb. - The correct reading sequence of misplaced quires 6 and 7 has been indicated by two notes in red, the first in the bottom margin of fol. 51v, the second in the bottom margin of fol. 59v and the third in the upper margin of fol. 60r: Fol. 51v (last leaf of quire 7 [in the sequence quire 6]): ኅልፍ፡ ኀበ፡ ፰ጥራዝ፡ ዘይቤ፡ ብርሃን። “Pass to the quire 8 which says: ብርሃን”; Fol. 59v (last leaf of quire 6 [in the sequence quire 7]): ተመለስ፡ አንባቢ፡ ኀበ፡ ፯ጥራዝ፡ ዘውእቱ፡ [fol. 60r] “Reader, go to quire 7, which (says): ውእቱ”; Fol. 60r (first leaf of quire 8): ዘተረሰአ፡ "Which was forgotten".

person.persName: According to the colophon, wayzaro Mǝḥrata Walda Kidān was the commissioner and donor of the book.
Several individuals (ʾabuna Gabra Yoḥannǝs on 24ra, Walatta Śǝllāse on 80va, Walatta Gäbrʾel on 79va, etc.) are mentioned in several supplication formulas.
